RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Maciel Zortea pesquisador no grupo Natural Resources Analytics da IBM Research Brasil. Tem experincia no desenvolvimento de metodologias para anlise de imagens e reconhecimento de padres, com aplicaes em sensoriamento remoto e dermatologia. Foi pesquisador snior (2011-2014) no Centro Noruegus de Computao em Oslo, um instituto de pesquisa privado, independente e sem fins lucrativos. Nele atuou em diversos projetos de pesquisa e desenvolvimento na rea de sensoriamento remoto utilizando imagens de sensores pticos e radar. Com formao multidisciplinar, possui graduao em Engenharia Civil (2001) e mestrado em Sensoriamento Remoto (2004) pela Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul, doutorado em Space Science and Engineering no departamento de Engenharia Biofsica e Eletrnica da Universidade de Gnova (2007). Ps-doutorados no Grupo de Redes Neurais e Processamento de Sinais da Universidade de Extremadura na Espanha (2008), e no Departamento de Matemtica e Estatstica da Universidade de Tromso na Noruega (2009-2011), onde colaborou com o Laboratrio de Telemedicina. Atua como revisor de vrios peridicos cientficos.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Maciel Zortea graduated as a Civil Engineer at the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, in Porto Alegre, Brazil (2002), where he received a MSc. in Remote Sensing (2004). He received the Ph.D. in Information and Communication Science and Technologies, curriculum in Space Science and Engineering, from the University of Genoa, Italy (2007). After concluding his Ph.D., he joined the Department of Technology of Computers and Communications at the University of Extremadura, Spain, where he worked as a Marie Curie Experienced Researcher within the Hyperspectral Imaging Network (2008). A post-doc research at the Department of Mathematics and Statistics, University of Troms, Norway, followed (2009). Currently he is a Research Scientist at the Norwegian Computing Center in Oslo. His main research interests include image analysis and pattern recognition methodologies for remote sensing and medical applications.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Financiamentos: - Mestrado na UFRGS: bolsa da CAPES. - Doutorado na Itlia: bolsa do governo Italiano, "Ministero dell'Istruzione, dell'Universit e della Ricerca". - Post-doc na Espanha: financiado pelo "FP6 Marie Curie Research Training Network, European Commission". - Post-doc na Noruega: financiado pelo "Norwegian Research Council".

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Desenvolvimento de mtodos para classificao e anlise de imagens digitais

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Estgio em Engenharia Civil realizado em canteiro de obra da empresa Quillery Ile de France, em Paris.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: IEEE Transactions on Geoscience and Remote Sensing
IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Letters

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
[PT] Pesquisador experiente Marie Curie (ER) no mbito do projeto Hyperspectral Imaging Network [http://hyperinet.eu]. A pesquisa foi realizada no Departamento de Tecnologia de Computadores e Comunicaes da Universidade de Extremadura, em Cceres, Espanha. Os principais temas de pesquisa incluiram extrao de pixels puros e desmistura de dados hiperespectrais.
[EN] Marie Curie Experienced Researcher (ER) within the framework of the Hyperspectral Imaging Network project [http://hyperinet.eu]. The research was conducted at the Department of Technology of Computers and Communications, University of Extremadura, Cceres, Spain. The main research topics included endmember extraction and unmixing of hyperpsectral data.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Redes Neuronales y Procesamiento de Seal (GRNPS)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: [EN] HYPER-I-NET was a four-year Marie Curie Research Training Network (RTN) designed to build an interdisciplinary European research community focusing on hyperspectral imaging. The theme of the network is at the confluence of heterogeneous disciplines, such as sensor design including optics and electronics, aerospace engineering, remote sensing, geosciences, computer sciences, signal processing and Earth observation related products. Dr. Zortea was integrated in a research effort led by Prof. Antonio Plaza, oriented towards the definition and implementation of advanced hyperspectral image processing techniques, in the context of remote sensing applications. More information in http://hyperinet.multimediacampus.it

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
[PT] Desenvolvimento de metodologias para reconhecimento de padres e anlise de imagens digitais, com nfase na segmentao, extrao de feies, e classificao, aplicadas ao problema de diagnstico computadorizado de leses de pele (melanoma) utilizando imagens dermoscpicas.
[EN] Development of methodologies for pattern recognition and digital image analysis, with emphasis on segmentation, feature extraction and classification, applied to computer aided diagnosis of skin lesions (melanoma) using dermoscopic images.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: IEEE Journal of Selected Topics in Applied Earth Obs. and Remote Sensing

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
[PT] Desenvolvimento de metodologias para anlise de dados de sensoriamento remoto no Departamento de Anlise Estatstica, Reconhecimento de Padres, e Anlise de Imagens. nfase em metodologias para classificao automtica e semiautomtica de imagens, reconhecimento de objetos, e estimao de parmetros geofsicos da superfcie terrestre.
[EN] Development of methodologies for analysis of digital remote sensing data at the Department of Statistical Analysis, Pattern Recognition and Image Analysis. In particular, methodologies for automatic and semi-automatic classification, object recognition, and parameter retrieval.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dept. of Statistical Analysis, Pattern Recognition and Image Analysis

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
[EN] This was a pilot project to study the market, organizational conditions, and the technical aspects of providing services based on Earth Observation in support of emergency management (EM).
In this project, NR was in partnership with KSAT, which serves daily about 60 satellites. Data from several of these are very relevant to EM. Client: Norwegian Space Centre.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dept. of Statistical Analysis, Pattern Recognition and Image Analysis

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Multisensor Satellite Technologies for Oil Pollution Monitoring and Source Identification
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: [EN] The overall objective of the this project was to improve the current state-of-the art methodology for satellite based oil spill detection and to demonstrate through deliveries to existing and new users how these improvements can contribute to the development of sustainable downstream service. The improvements of the oil spill detection service were achieved by integrating new geo-information products from the Marine Core Service or MyOcean, and complementary optical images into innovative methods for oil spill detection. Client: European Commission.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Multisensor Satellite Technologies for Oil Pollution Monitoring and Source Identification

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dept. of Statistical Analysis, Pattern Recognition and Image Analysis

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Localization and monitoring of cultural heritage
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: [EN] This project develops semi-automatic methods for detecting and mapping cultural heritage in Norway. The overall goal is to develop a cost-effective method for surveying and monitoring sites on a regional and national scale. In particular we aim at developing algorithms for semi-automatic detection of grave mounds and iron extraction sites in airborne laser scanning data (LiDAR). Client: Norwegian Directorate for Cultural Heritage.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Localization and monitoring of cultural heritage

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: [EN] Tropical forest monitoring in Tanzania is challenging due to frequent and partial cloud cover. Also, there are large seasonal variations in the spectral response of vegetation, due to the rain seasons and dry periods. This means that detecting forest changes simply by classifying two satellite images taken a few years apart, and compute the difference, will not work well in practice. We are using a Hidden Markov Model approach to address these and other challenges in order to do forest mapping and forest change detection. The method is based on using a large time series of images that are processed automatically. Client: The Government of Norway/Tanzania.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dept. of Statistical Analysis, Pattern Recognition and Image Analysis

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Cost-effective observation methodology to assess seal population sizes using unmanned aerial vehicle and automatic image analysis
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: [EN] The abundance estimation of ice breeding seals (harp and hooded) and coastal seals (grey and harbour) are based on aerial photographic surveys and manual inspection of aerial photographs. Photo surveys in remote areas (the Arctic) are expensive and the logistics have become increasingly difficult during the last years. Manual analysis of the images is extremely time consuming and costly, and involves subjective human interpretation by trained experts. The Norwegian Computing Center (NR) will focus on developing methodology for automating the process of counting seals from aerial images. This will be achieved through the development of new image analysis and pattern recognition techniques tailored to detect seals in digital color images. NR will also investigate the potential of thermal infrared sensors that extract temperature characteristics of the imaged objects. Several partner institutions are involved in the project. Financing: The Research Council of Norway.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Cost-effective observation methodology to assess seal population sizes using unmanned aerial vehicle and automatic image analysis

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Monitoring and mapping of environmental gradients using Sentinel data in combination with supplemental data
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: [EN] Traditionally, the aim of using remote sensing in the context of nature conservation and environmental monitoring / ecosystem management has been to classify remotely sensed data into e.g. vegetation or land cover classes. Mapping discrete types of nature however is already challenging when conducted manually due to the fractal characteristic of nature and the very often gradual changes in pattern. For that reason vegetation mapping using satellites like Landsat often results in mapping products with limited benefit when applied to complex and heterogeneous vegetation cover. The main objective of this project is to develop and advance a novel approach to remote sensing, which focuses on monitoring basic environmental gradients and properties (covering physical, chemical and biological components as well as their interactions), rather than discrete mapping of vegetation classes. Partner: Norwegian Institute for Nature Research (NINA). Financing: ESA/Prodex.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Monitoring and mapping of environmental gradients using Sentinel data in combination with supplemental data

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: [PT] Breve colaborao no desenvolvimento de um sistema meteo-hidrolgico para monitoramento, previso e alerta em tempo real de eventos de risco para a Proteo Civil Italiana. O sistema combinava medies de imagens de satlite, radar meteorolgico, e estaes terrestres. [EN] Short term colaboration on the development of a meteo-hydrological monitoring system for real-time monitoring, forecasting and warning of risk events for the Italian Civil Protection. The system combined measurements from satellite imagery, meteorological radar, and ground stations.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: ISPRS Journal of Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing
Gipsa-lab Grenoble Images Parole Signal et Automat

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Pesquisador visitante no GIPSA-Lab, Dpartement des Images et des Signaux, Grenoble Institute of Technology. Breve estadia trabalhando em tpicos relacionados ao processamento de imagens hiperespectrais no mbito do projeto Hyperspectral Imaging Network [http://hyperinet.eu]. Anfitrio Prof. Dr. Jocelyn Chanussot.
